title: Margaret Bourke-White
summary: Margaret Bourke-White (/ˈbɜːrk/; June 14, 1904 – August 27, 1971), an American photographer and documentary photographer,[1] became arguably best known as the first foreign photographer permitted to take pictures of  Soviet industry under the Soviets'  five-year plan,[2] as the first American female war photojournalist, and for having one of her photographs (on the construction of Fort Peck Dam) on the cover of the first issue of  Life magazine.[3] She died of Parkinson's disease at age 67, about eighteen years after developing symptoms.
